instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
Hi.

I have an A1286 820-2915-A, that only works with power cable connected.

Battery isen't recognized is macOS.

Already tried a known good battery, but same result.

SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL/SDA lines on battery conector seams to be ok: 0.550 in diode reading.

Can you help?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message: What is the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage (without battery connected)?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H is 12.58V w/o battery.

With the LID conector disconected is the same result.

Shall I replace U7000?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
Do you have correct voltage on SCL/SDA lines too?
Any history available?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
No history. Just stoped working, the client says.

SCL/SDA on battery conector are 3.47V (I think that they are correct)

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
Hi,
Already disconected BIL, but same result.

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message: Change U7000 first, but probably need to change SMC...

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
Hi,
Replaced SMC and U7000, but same result. Not charging

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
Check R6950.
Do you get PPBUS_G3H with battery alone (no charger)?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
Hi,
I get 2.3V on PPBUS_G3H with only the battery connected, but this battery probably is almost discharged.
R6950 seams to be ok and has 9.8 kohm

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
Check with known good battery; even one from A1278 can help for test.
Also test actual one into other machine (A1278 maybe).

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no battery
threads.message:
It were the batteries (tried with 3 different ones, and all were bad). The last one was good, and now it is charging.
TKS!
